com.lonepulse.robozombie.processor
Interface Processor<RESULT,FAILURE extends Throwable>

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractProcessorChain, RequestProcessorChain, ResponseProcessorChain
public interface Processor<RESULT,FAILURE extends Throwable>

This contract defines a strategy which accepts data, acts on them (based on predefined instructions) and returns a result. It's designed to be as generic as possible; any concrete or abstract implementation may override run(Object...) to suit itself.

Note that implementations are discouraged from using this contract to model command objects.

Since:
1.3.0

Version:
1.1.0

Author:
Lahiru Sahan Jayasinghe

Method Summary
 RESULT run(Object... args)
          Accepts a generic argument array (which is expected to contain all the required information), executes the strategy and returns a result of the assigned type.
 

Method Detail

run

RESULT run(Object... args)
           throws FAILURE extends Throwable

Accepts a generic argument array (which is expected to contain all the required information), executes the strategy and returns a result of the assigned type. Ensure that you validate the incoming the argument array and wrap any disparate exceptions in instance of the assigned exception type. All exceptions which indicate a failed precondition (e.g. IllegalArgumentException) should be properly documented.

Parameters:
args - a generic array of arguments which is expected to contain all the required information

Returns:
an instance of the assigned type if processing completed successfully; else null if this strategy is not expected to return a result - such processors should define Void for the generic RESULT type

Throws:
FAILURE - if the strategy failed to complete successfully; the type of the Throwable should be strictly indicative of a failure in the strategy and not of a failure in the preconditions; Processors which are recoverable should not define a RuntimeException for the generic FAILURE type

FAILURE extends Throwable
Since:
1.3.0
